channel.title: Commands
channel.description:
How to i set commands like
::home ::train ::bank ::shops
ect.
Please tell me and give examples of everything because i am only JUST starting with JAVA coding.

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("name")) { // What you want it to do.. }

item.title: Commands
item.dc:creator: @usman555 usman555
item.description:
@usman555 wrote:

same thing, all of the thing’s he stated are teleports to somewhere, except for bank which ill explain and give right now

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("bank") && playerRights >= 1) { openUpBank(); }
line 1 is just the command. so if the command is bank, and the playerRights are bigger than or equal to 1 (bigger or equal to mod), then do this:

line 2 basically opens the bank

line 3 is a finishing touch. Like pure said, for every { you put, you must put that amount of }'s.

Yah, and ::train is also a teleport, it teleports you to a training area

Read full topic

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("COMMAND") && playerRights >= 0) { toX = your x axis coordinates here; toY = your y axis coordinates here; sM("Message to send in chatbox shit."); }[/quote]it could be for the ::home/shops teleport.

item.title: Commands
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

customCommands method.
lemme quickly explain how.

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("COMMAND") && playerRights >= 0) {

Now that first line declares what we need to type to access the command, in this case it is ::command
notice i put equalsIgnoreCase which means the command is not case sensitive however if i made it equals alone it would only work on ::COMMAND in capitals. && playerRights >= 0 means your player rights must be 0 or higher to use this command.

>= higherThenThis == mustBeExact

Now the actual Teleport.

toX = your x axis coordinates here; toY = your y axis coordinates here;
which is pretty self explanatory

sM("Message to send in chatbox shit.");

which is self explanatory

and finally } to end the command;
Protip(s): for every { there is a } somewhere; forgetting this can result in 100 errors.
Java is case sensitive playername wont work playerName would work.

Read full topic

item.title: Commands
item.dc:creator: @usman555 usman555
item.description:
@usman555 wrote:

your pretty much asking for how to make teleport commands
well i’ll describe em for you

line 1:

if(command.startsWith("home")) {

now what this does is: if the command you type in has a “home” word in it,

line 2:

toX = 1234;

this is a pretty straight forward part, it teleports you to the 1234’th x corrdinate in the runescape grid

line 3:

toY = 5678;

this is the same as line 2, except it teleports to the 5678’th y coordinate in the grid

line 4:

}

the most easiest part, yet the most confusing part of the entire code. The finishing bracket(s)
This ends the code, yet people get 100 errors when they do it wrong. Now since this is a straight forward code, you only need one of these. So put this in the code.

so pretty much, your code looks like this:

if(command.startsWith("home")){ toX = 1234; toY = 5678; }

now remember the corrdinates 12345678 arent the real coords, you gotta do the ::mypos command to find your coords. This is helpful, since you can do ::mypos in the place where you wanna make a teleport.

Read full topic

item.title: Commands
item.dc:creator: @Joeli Joeli
item.description:
@Joeli wrote:

What do you mean with ::train , a teleport o a command that set you levels auto?
BTW, teleports must be something like

if(command.equalsIgnoreCase("Command1")){ teleportToX = cordinate x; teleportToY = cordinate y; sendMessage("You have teleported to shops/home");

}

Read full topic
